name: Tiramolla Bed 351
about:
Composing to the infinity without limits this is our philosophy base for the TIRAMOLLA project.‎ Through a structure of tubes and aluminium moulds, all your fantastic space mounts as a game, freeing the fantasy with the use of 32 colors, 5 melamines, 10 colors of metal and 6 colors of methacrylates, constructing closets under the beds, the beds over the closets, the bureaus under the beds or over the closets.‎ You can have fun to decorate with an unique personalisation furnitures and the walls of your space through the application of “stickers” self-sticking white , silver, red, blue with original and pleasant shapes.‎

A project up to date with times and keeping up with today’s active youngsters, with desire for discovery, novelty, and the curiosity to travel to meet new people and discover different cultures.‎ The collection is characterised by free, personalized, creative compositions, suitable to the needs of all ages.‎

Therefore, fantasy is let loose, beds above wardrobes, pull-in beds, wardrobes under the beds, doors and walls of bookcases decorated with fabrics and digital prints, materials and colours able to create a home with different styles, from vintage, to shabby, modern and contemporary.‎ A mix of atmospheres created to confer colour, taste and an endless sense of freedom to today’s youngsters.‎

name: Tiramolla Tables 307
about:
By using the cut-off residues, he invented in 1935 for his own children a collection called MOUETTE consisting of an armchair and a side table.‎ TOLIX has decided to expand this collection by retaining only the recognizable seat and its seven holes, introducing an already iconic children's stool, much like the H stool.‎

M stands for miniature, meticulous, and metallic.‎  But above all, M stands for MOUETTE (Seagull), a charming name given by Xavier Pauchard to this collection that he designed for his own children  and to make use of the metal scraps that were previously wasted.‎ Xavier Pauchard was a pioneer in simplicity and non-waste.‎ Thanks to  the M collection, children find their place in the TOLIX universe.‎

name: Tiramolla Tables 313
about:
Unveiled in 2023, the TOLIX UD Table is inspired by the esteemed UD collection, a tribute to the University of Dijon.‎ Echoing the design of the UD chair, this masterful piece features an oak tabletop crafted by a cabinetmaker from the Morvan, elevating the realm of interior design.‎ It skillfully combines the sturdiness of steel with the warmth of wood, showcasing timeless elegance.‎

Designed to comfortably seat eight guests, its robust structure and minimalist tabletop epitomize unparalleled functionality.‎ Jean Pauchard, a visionary spirit of his time, would undoubtedly have praised this modern addition, honoring TOLIX's legacy while meeting contemporary tastes.‎ Ideal for discerning interiors, the UD Table transcends mere furniture; it stands as a testament to the renewed French craftsmanship and design.‎

The first UD chairs were born in 1958, at the initiative of Jean Pauchard for an order from the University of Dijon.‎ They are characterized by a tubular structure, a perforated backrest with three slender and curved tubes, and a seat padded with Formica and faux leather.‎ Other versions will follow, such as the UD2 chair in 1963 with a beechwood seat.‎

The UD chair, characterized by its light and feminine lines, is revisited by Studio Tolix and is accompanied by a table whose delicate curves perfectly complement a steel top that seems to float in suspension.‎ A version with a stained oak top crafted by a Morvan cabinetmaker gives it an even more pronounced character.‎

The UD collection stands out with its deep black-brown paint or its glossy white finish.‎ It integrates perfectly into demanding interiors, offering all-steel or all-wood options to meet preferences for minimalism or warmth.‎ In the future, new material will enrich its seating,thereby enhancing its seductive power.‎

name: Anthony Chair 219
about:
The AC16 chair with armrests, a variation of the AC chair model, maintains the wide seat that contributed to its success, especially in North America.‎ Its notable feature is the extension of the backrest into fluid armrests, enhancing comfort.‎ Adaptable for various settings, it fits well at the end of a table, as an occasional chair in an entryway, or as an office chair in both private and professional environments.‎

Built on the same fundamentals as the AC chair, each production stage relies on TOLIX's craftsmanship: stamping, bending, brazing, and polishing.‎ These unique processes, recognized by TOLIX's Living Heritage Company status, impart a distinctive quality and soul to the products.‎

TOLIX offers the AC16 chair in a glossy pure white finish reveals the curvature work, presenting a streamlined vision of contemporary furniture.‎

name: Tiramolla Desks 098
about:
Tenon stand desk is designed to accommodate for the increasing number of people working from home.‎ Unlike most stands desk, Tenon has four legs, making it appear more like home furniture.‎ Its hardwood desktop and metal frame have rounded edges for improved ergonomics.‎ Tenon is tech-enabled and features built-in power sockets, usb ports, ambient light, and a touch screen.‎ Unique accessories can attach to various places on the desk and work with the slot in the desktop, such as the integrated laptop holder.‎ Tenon also has a cable management system to keep the workspace as near as possible.‎

Tenon is designed be a fitting addition to any modern home environment.‎ Using quality materials such as red oak and walnut.‎ The signature chamfer and rounded edges both improve ergonomics and give Tenon a friendly appearance.‎ Customize ambient light and people are familiar with.‎ The desktop is milled and treated with waterproof coating, frame beams are extruded aluminum, the corners are die-cast aluminum and the legs are made of steel.‎ If freestanding, we have a pressed felt light diffuser attachment.‎ 

Equipped with the dock station Pebble Pro, the user only needs one USB to charge and connect their laptop to everything in and on the desk.‎ The desk has USB charging ports and four power outlets.‎ A simple double tap on the OLED acts as a shortcut between stand and sit modes, and ambient sight serves as a non-intrusive reminder indicator when the built-in standing timer is up.‎ Cables can be kept within range but of sight using the cable holder specifically designed for the desktop slot.‎ Even the wireless charger can fold into the slot to hide its cable.‎ As an IoT product, it can be part of home automation, and Siri enabled.‎

Beflo aimed to create a tech-enabled stand desk that takes care of all the needs of the modern remote worker.‎ We want our desk to have presence through elegant, minimalist designed premium materials.‎ Having a certain level of modularity creates many opportunities for add-ons which make work more pleasant and the workspace less cluttered.‎ Our signature desk slot enables unique solutions such as the integrated laptop holder, as well as monitor stand which has no visible base and lets the cables run straight through the desktop.‎ Our connectivity solutions leave almost nothing to be desired for the average user.‎

Beflo took a holistic approach with people’s mental and physical wellbeing in mind.‎ Everything about our product is made to improve people’s quality life by promoting better posture and by offering a work environment that could be described as Zen.‎ People spend a third of their lives working, and an additional portion using desks for personal use.‎ If everybody felt comfortable and taken care of at their workspace, the world would certainly be a better place.‎ For Beflo the biggest factor of sustainability is a product’s lifepart, so our desk is designed to be robust using high quality materials to ensure it will outlast its user.‎

name: Anthony Chair 2190
about: “A handcrafted hi-tech cloud-like chair” is how the designers at Archirivolto described their latest design for de Sede.‎ With its distinctive compartments, it looks so cosy that you just want to sink into it, as if into a cloud.‎ Not only the distinctive shape and uncompromising quality of its artisanal design catch the eye but also the comfort of the seat thanks to its excellent ergonomic design that guarantees good posture.‎

name: Tiramoli workstation 345
about:
E-Media collection is a melamine multimedia system designed to suit the market requirements and to offer a complete piece of furnishing for the interactive office spaces, including specific tools for remote communication.‎ This range perfectly combines functionality and design.‎
The whole structure is made of melamine panels 25 mm thick, available in the finishes listed in the price list.‎ The monitor-holder plate is made of bent sheet metal.‎ An under top compartment is provided with metal trays for the channels and a practical wire management, plus an openable melamine door that permits a quick inspection.‎  
The worktop is equipped as a standard with a top access for inspection, and is proposed in two heights, H74 cm for the sitting position and H107 cm for the standing one.‎

name: Tiramoli storage unit 675
about:
Slim, multifunctional and fully electrified: WINEA SLIM from WINI (Design: Michael Hilgers) is the smart, space-efficient storage solution for the office.‎

The modular system connects directly to the work surface and thus provides practical, space-saving private storage space directly at the workplace - including clever technology integration.‎ For more comfort in the office day, WINEA SLIM can be individually equipped and configured as a compact, elegant individual workplace as well as a generous bench or team workplace.‎

Equipment details/options: lockable drawers, lockable wing doors, shelves, shelves and flower tops, top, pull-out standing board; Unilateral or reciprocal use; Fixed or height adjustable table attachment; Cable outlets, luminaire connection, Netbox Point, induction charging field.‎

name: Tiramolla stools 908
about: Smith is a multifunctional item of furniture made of powder-coated sheet metal.‎ It is the epitome of flexibility and can be used as small cabinet in the office, as a low table, a bookcase or a stool.‎ The piece can be hung from the side of a desk or easily moved around the workplace on its four wheels.‎ In 2011 Smith was won the prestigious Compasso d’Oro award for its “productive and constructive ingenuity accompanied by remarkable multi-functionality”.‎

name: sameer Monoblock kitchen 235
about:
The electrical appliances and accessories in standard version include fridge, cooker top with electric or gas rings, sink unit with one basin plus drip board, tap, syphon, dustbin, hood, dish drainer, water-repellent top, steel protection.‎ The Small Kitchen is very functional and simple to assemble.‎

Model Zeus and model Fashion are made in melamine panels with thickness 38mm, anti-scratch and rimmed with ABS on all four sides.‎ Wardrobes’ door have 4 hinges while drawers’guide rails are made in metal with stopping mechanism; rods for hanging clothes are in metal.‎ Model Zeus and model Fashion are also available with silver color border or in the “minimal” version without doors or drawers; the elements of the two models can be combined with each other.‎
All panels are realized with a technical space of 7cm.‎ behind.‎ This allows the electric wires to be easily brought outside in order to place the light or the plug in the most appropriate position of the room, no matter from where the wires come out from the wall behind the panel.‎

name: Saif Desks 897
about:
This tubular steel desk is a successful example of the Bauhaus' programmatic claim of combining art and technology into a formal unit.‎ The tabletop and storage elements made of varnished or stained wood harmonically fit in with the tubular steel design.‎ The supporting frame consists of a single line; the wooden elements seem to float in it.‎ The simple piece of furniture, which is formally balanced in its proportions, represents an expressive piece of contemporary history known as "The New Objectivity.‎" We produce various versions of this model.‎
Frame chrome-plated tubular steel, body in stained oak and ash, ash open pore lacquer or body lacquered in various colors.‎ Drawers lockable with central lock.‎ Also available as a version with open shelf compartments or in a "Pure Materials" version with oiled walnut veneer.‎
Current product changes:
- We have equipped the desk's drawers with a self-closing drawer track.‎
- The desks are also available in a mirror-inverted version.‎ Please indicate on your order!

name: saif sofas 567
about:
Frame: made in fir wood and multi-ply panels.‎The support system is created using 90 mm wide interwoven elastic straps.‎
Padding: seat cushions and back cushions in polyurethane foam with differentiated density 35 km 30 s 40 p covered with dacron 150 gr.‎
Padding goose down: seat cushions and back cushions in sterilized goose down with polyurethane insert differentiated densities 35 km 30 s 40 p covered in cotton muslin.‎
Cover: completely removable fabric.‎
Finishes: feet in black abs.‎

Bagutta, a design by Marconato & Zappa, is the new modular sofa, presented at  ideal for reception spaces in both residential and contract settings.‎ Its enveloping line, like an embrace, is created from ergonomic shapes to give maximum comfort.‎ The Bagutta line is a unique system of upholstered furniture with which it is possible to create a multiplicity of combinations, inventing original games of volumes, following a rhythm of solids and voids.‎ All the elements of the line can be personalised or custom made.‎ The supporting structure of the sofa is made of solid fir wood or plywood.‎  Flexibility is guaranteed by 90 mm wide woven elastic belts.‎ The padding, both of the seat and of the back cushion is in triple density polyurethane whose flexibility is also due to the woven elastic support straps.‎ The Bagutta modular sofa is built to last thanks to its bearing structure and the removable cover (in the case of fabric covering).‎You can also completely renew the sofa after 5-10 years of use, at a small cost, for replacement of the covers with a new fabric according to current trends.‎ Thanks to its contemporary design, this custom modular sofa goes perfectly with the living room tables Tape, Charme, Selfy and Allure.‎ The collection also includes connecting tables with marble tops in the variants indicated in the price list and with a fabric-covered base.‎

name: Saif Canteen tables 345
about: This table for two is much more than just a table seating two people.‎ Picnik was of course primarily designed as a table and bench seat combination for small outdoor spaces.‎ But thanks to its striking looks – both solid and stylized at the same time – Picnik is also frequently used indoors.‎ Combining several Picnik tables in (semi) public spaces creates an almost artistic effect.‎ It is therefore not at all surprising that Tate Modern chose Picnik for its visitor resting spots.‎ After having won seven design awards, it is clear that Picnik will go down in design history as a true style icon.‎

name: Anthony Chair 21901
about:
Seta MC24 is a chair in ash wood frame with non-removable seat upholstery available in 5 finishes: natural, black, grey, red, neon blue.‎

Seta, a stackable and armless timber chair, designed by Foster + Partners in collaboration with the Italian manufacturer Mattiazzi, brings together an honesty of materiality with a deep understanding of CNC technology to create a unique piece of furniture.‎ Made from sustainably sourced ash timber, the lightweight chair is strong and enduring.‎ Each surface is machined and curved to define its form.‎

Mike Holland, Senior Partner and Head of Industrial Design, Foster + Partners, said: “The possibilities offered by CNC technology are endless.‎ The challenge was to use it in a restrained manner that reduces wastage and produces an efficient, soft geometry that characterises the furniture range.‎ The form emerged from a deep understanding of the tools that influenced the final form of the chair.‎ The result is an inviting and approachable chair that offers maximum durability and flexibility.‎”

As wellbeing in the workplace has come into sharper focus and the desire for warmer, more tactile furniture grows, the Seta chair offers a solution that is suited to a variety of settings from office and commercial to domestic uses.‎

name: Tiramolla Tables 3071
about:
Leva MC21 is an armchair in ash wood frame with non-removable seat upholstery available in 4 finishes: natural, black, grey, red.‎

Leva is the first timber chair designed by Foster + Partners.‎ Inspired by the efficiency of the form and materiality of an oar, Leva is designed ergonomically: its steam-bent arms, made of a single piece of machined timber, are slightly inclined, widening in the middle to form a comfortable, supportive backrest.‎ Leva's seemingly simple shape is the result of complex surfacing that optimises the chair for mass production.‎ The sparing use of material is rooted in the idea of sustainability – to do more with less.‎ Leva relies on Mattiazzi’s craftsmanship and sophisticated machinery to manufacture a wood chair that is quiet in numbers.‎ 

"The chair remains the archetypal furniture piece and one of the most difficult objects to design, requiring a deep understanding of form and comfort.‎ It must be pleasing to the eye, able to fit a variety of settings from living rooms to restaurants, comfortable to sit on, and durable enough to last generations.‎" Mike Holland, Head of Industrial Design, Foster + Partners

name: Anthony Tables 456
about:
Anish Wood is the new version of the coffee table designed by Rodolfo Dordoni, now featuring new materials, shapes and dimensions.‎
The circular or elliptical Licorice coloured ash top has edges smoothed like a river pebble, the result of in-depth technological research, and rests on the characteristic polished Chrome or Pewter metal base.‎ The large coffee table for the centre of the lounge, on the other hand, is proposed in a single-material solid wood version, with the top resting on two curved bases, crafted with exquisite manufacturing skill.‎
The possibility of combining coffee tables of different heights allows Anish Wood to interpret the new ways of contemporary living with a high degree of versatility.‎

name: Saif Booths 209
about:
The smallest restaurant spaces or terraces can be comfortably furnished with Bench S.‎ Our Benches also serve as a supplement to the Cubes if you prefer to place two-seaters opposite one another instead of chairs.‎ The cover options range from weatherproof outdoor fabrics with an unusually pleasant feel and lotus blossom effect to certified fire-safe fabrics cover materials.‎ All with easy-care properties that remedy every drink and food faux-pas and make it easy work to maintain.‎

Modularity and flexibility are the core skills of IKONO furniture, and a cornerstone for the new Gastro System.‎ The simple fact that it can be uniformly used both in the inside and outside areas of a restaurant opens up a variety of new possibilities.‎ What's more, the lotus blossom effect on all fabric surfaces can remedy even the greatest red wine faux-pas and make it easy work to maintain.‎ With the Gastro System, floor spaces can be reinvented time and time again.‎ Units fixed to the wall are passé, and otherwise elaborate retrofitting can be made in just a few simple steps.‎

name: Manish Display unit 456
Ayesha Display unit 567
Ayush Display unit 567
Manish Display Cases 456
Ayesha Display Cases 675
about:
Cozy International designs proposals for Made in Italy and tailor-made walk-in closets for lovers of luxury: unique and sophisticated furnishing compositions to meet the needs of contemporary living.‎

Cosy International prestigious walk in closets are the result of a solution-based planning, which includes an extreme attention to details and a refined execution of the whole project.‎ The luxurious materials are highlighted by an unseen eclecticism which is embedded in the emblematic originality of the Italian style luxury furniture that in Cosy’s case combines elements of the most classic Tuscan tradition such as the typical workmanship versatility that has been passed on over centuries in a process of skills acquisition dated back to the industrial evolution.‎ Thus, the luxury wardrobe closet becomes a timeless, functional and technological work of art, refined and spectacular at the same time.‎

The design of the ideal and glamorous walk in closet must consider the characteristics of the home environment, its intended use and the style of choice based on the needs of those who live there.‎ Thus, the design isn’t about luxury classic Italian furniture only, but also all the decorative elements that can be included and customized on request.‎

The experience as a company within the luxury Italian furniture industry and the reasons behind the success are based on a professional rule of conduct that follows a precise and meticulous sequence of steps in the design and complete planning of the project.‎

First, a preliminary on-site inspection service of the exact dimensions of the space that need to be furnished, executed by one of Cosy representatives.‎

Then, the design of the ultimate elegant walk in closet including all the customized elements based on the customer’s specific needs.‎

Finally, the execution of the project following the design of the exclusive luxury walk in closet, always under the supervision of one of Cosy professionals who will also take care of the on-site installation.‎ Moreover, Cosy relies on its exclusive supply chain which guarantees an even higher quality for a superior luxury walk in closet.‎

name: Ayesha hairdresser chair 678
about:
Queen Mary is a styling chair with swivel seat, high density comfort foam and MW bag hook.‎ Available in multiple colors.‎

Poetic and functional, the Jane Collection respects specific technical requirements, includes the best materials, and ergonomically responds to the comfort of both the client and the stylist.‎ This collection includes versatile pieces that complement each other and create a harmonious environment, independent of the salon in which they will be placed.‎ The Jane Collection by Marcel Wanders brings the luxury of a spa to professional salons that want to create refined environments capable of bringing together functionality and well-being.‎ The poetic curves, precise shapes, luxurious details and versatile accessories of the collection characterize the design of these products, which can transform any space into an elegant and welcoming environment.‎

Designed to offer functionality that can elevate the spirit, the collection brings a fresh breeze to the professional hairdressing sector, showing a perfect balance between utility and aesthetics.‎ The design of the products reflects the human body in a state of rest, allowing customers to discover beauty while taking care of their beauty.‎ The collection includes an iconic central workplace, a work chair, a wash unit, a waiting bench, a set of mirrors and a reception desk.‎ The skai coverings are offered with a floral embroidery that stimulates a profound visual and physical sensation in the customer.‎ The metal structures and details are available with gold, chrome or matt black finishes.‎ The pieces in this collection are versatile and complementary to make sure the concept was consistent, regardless of the specific characteristics of each salon.‎ While this collection impresses beautifully as a whole, each piece emerges as a symbol of individual beauty.‎

name: Ayesha furnishing 6789
about: Conceived almost as an architectural component, Big is a metal bookcase that features solid uprights in extruded aluminium, “T” section, and shelves in sheet with a definitely marked front edge, looking like masonry shelves.‎ Its well-defined shapes make it “multipurpose”, to emphasize modern, hi-tech, classic or period settings.‎

name: Tiramoli Mini kitchen 68
about:
In a stylish way the A LA CARTE II system breaks down the conventional kitchen structure into individual task modules.‎ In multiple combinations an individual kitchen can be composed to match personal needs and given space.‎ Convertible (wall-mounted, free-standing or as a room divider) and extendable any time.‎ Also convenient is the smart construction that provides adequate space for installation and cable runs.‎ A strong magnet joins the modules one to another, creating the active zone.‎ A variety of smart and functional elements can be used between the defined work stations.‎

The furniture look-and-feel of A LA CARTE II is ideal for office interiors as well as for the privacy of your home.‎ It provides various options, both in looks and in construction.‎ The smart double-wall design of the construction provides adequate space for installation and cable runs for the connection of any electrical appliance within each unit or between the units and for their ventilation.‎ The notches and the bisected back cover eliminate the need for machining even for water pipes.‎

The active zone of kitchen A LA CARTE II system offers high efficiency for limited space: Various repositories ensure effective operations in the kitchen.‎ Prepared sets are available but combinations can also be selected individually.‎ The active zone is created by connecting the modules of kitchen A LA CARTE II.‎ A variety of smart and functional elements can be used between the defined work stations.‎ Except for the sink module two drawers are standard equipment.‎

There are several options to equip the middle section: Any electrical appliance of the compact class (oven / steamer / dish washer/ cool drawer) can be integrated as well as a waste system or additional storage by two extra drawers.‎ Levelling the modules is provided by the vertically adjustable aluminium feet.‎ The two sockets element “Twist” is offered as additional equipment to be fitted in any working top.‎ Depending on the space available the modules of the A LA CARTE II system can meet any upcoming needs.‎ A small coffee-kitchen is just as easy to realize as a stylish apartment kitchenette or a great kitchen block.‎

name: Tiramoli Kitchen 234
about:
OFF KITCHEN - The “reversible” space: a conference hall for a contemporary office becomes, simultaneously, a fully functional kitchen.‎
The central table features an extractable surface which doubles the surface area.‎ A sink and induction hob are contained inside the surface itself, accessed though practical folding shutters.‎ The overhead extractor fan system is remote-controlled.‎
The cabinetry is equipped with domestic appliances, storage space and drawers.‎
The table is created entirely in Corian.‎ The cabinetry is finished with a matt white lacquer.‎

about:
Kitchen design always incorporates the study of optimal solutions for worktops: functional accessorised areas or simply surfaces offering enough space for the correct preparation of food.‎
The worktops exclusive to Arclinea, flat and with recesses or drip guards, are engineered to allow for dedicated design and for their integration with functional elements.‎ They are available for wall-mounted and island/peninsula kitchen projects and can be applied to any model of the Collection.‎

name: Ayush Cookers 567
about:
Alpes-Inox has always taken special care over its cooking solutions, for there are the true heart of the kitchen.‎ The cooking elements are innovative, reliable and of elegant simplicity, since aesthetics follow on from functionality.‎

“Free in the kitchen”, the collection of freestanding kitchens is also about the freedom to customise and invent: with different materials, sizes and assemblies, either horizontally or vertically, for interiors or exteriors, or everything to measure, giving you free rein to rewrite the rules.‎ It breaks free from the restraints of definition, convention and fashion.‎ The modules are highly versatile and allow you to play freely with the structure of the kitchen and combine complementary elements serving separate functions (washing, food preparation, cooking, freezing, storage) or divide them into separate sections bringing together all the vital functions of the kitchen.‎ Chrome-nickel steel with an unmistakable silver finish, a minimalist style and perfect industrial ergonomics make the Liberi in Cucina units look iconic as well as contemporary, free from the restraints of fashion and convention and able to complement any style and context.‎ The freestanding modules can be moved, altered, reconfigured and added to over time.‎ Featuring Alpes’ distinctive and exceptional quality of manufacture that makes them indestructible, they easily adapt to the changes and new needs of daily life, unrestricted by time and space and able to convey any emotional, aesthetic and functional value that you may wish to pass on down.‎ Alpes’ distinctive and exceptional quality of manufacture that makes them indestructible, they easily adapt to the changes and new needs of daily life, unrestricted by time and space and able to convey any emotional, aesthetic and functional value that you may wish to pass on down.‎ Liberi in cucina is the system of independent elements that goes beyond the traditional concept of cooking.‎

name: Tiramoli Freestanding units 234
about:
Inspired by the minimalism and straight lines of Italy’s industrial heritage, Very Simple Kitchen was founded with the desire to reinvent kitchen’s space.‎
The products are a combination of industrial style and simple forms with careful attention paid to the use of colors, materials and finishings.‎
Very Simple Kitchen is based in Bologna, all products are manufactured in Italy and can shipped internationally.‎

name: Manish sofa 56
about: Composed of sofa, table, chairs and sunbeds, Venice collection responds to the desire of its creators to imagine products that gave the impression of floating on the water, just like wooden rafts.‎ The sofa thus becomes floating, like a boat in the middle of the sea, able to navigate the dreams and fantasies of anyone who sits on it.‎ Later, they added lightweight interwoven backs and cushions that, on the particular structure, become like sails that push the imagination into a new dimension.‎ The whole collection is based on the ability of designers to make their own style from the brand, enhancing the know-how acquired over the years and creating families of multi-material and innovative products.‎

name: Sameer armchair 67
about: Kiori series is composed of an armchair and two and three-seater sofas.‎ The structure in sassafras heartwood is covered with a hand-weave in Conwood, a material consisting of strips in Abonos™ elm heartwood coupled with a cork support that makes them elastic and enduring at the same time.‎ Seat and backrest cushions, in polyester fiber with an expanded polyurethane support, are independent and with removable cover available in all of the exclusive outdoor fabrics in the collection.‎

name: Ayush benches 67
about: Kiori series is composed of an armchair and two and three-seater sofas.‎ The structure in sassafras heartwood is covered with a hand-weave in Conwood, a material consisting of strips in Abonos™ elm heartwood coupled with a cork support that makes them elastic and enduring at the same time.‎ Seat and backrest cushions, in polyester fiber with an expanded polyurethane support, are independent and with removable cover available in all of the exclusive outdoor fabrics in the collection.‎

name: Ayush armchair 56
about:
Designed by Norwegian designers Andreas Engesvik and Daniel Rybakken, the Arbour Club Armchair embodies the concept that design should follow construction.‎ Assembled from independently produced components for optimal comfort, quality and efficiency, the compact and durable armchair comprises seat and back cushions in carefully balanced proportions, with the frame creating a strong yet elegant profile with an architectural quality.‎ With its logical construction and uncluttered design language, the Arbour Club Armchair fuses its distinctly Scandinavian aesthetics with high comfort and great durability.‎ It is available with different upholstery options and is ideal for small spaces or for combining with other Arbour models in larger living rooms or hospitality areas.‎


 

Embodying the concept that design should follow construction, Andreas Engesvik and Daniel Rybakken’s Arbour is assembled from separate components that have been independently produced for optimal comfort, quality, and efficiency.‎ This sofa was developed with an intention to create a durable sofa that would qualify for the Nordic Swan Ecolabel within the European market, and it features FSC-certified wood with water-based lacquer for the frame and EU-Ecolabelled upholsteries for the Eco version.‎

The seat and cushions are made in carefully balanced proportions, with identical side cushions creating a sense of harmony and offering the opportunity for multiple comfortable sitting or lying positions, while the frame creates a strong yet elegant profile with an architectural quality.‎ With its logical construction and uncluttered design language, Arbour fuses its distinctly Scandinavian aesthetics with high comfort and great durability.‎
Available with different upholstery options.‎

Approved EU-Ecolabelled textiles for the Nordic Swan Ecolabelled Arbour: Atlas, Remix, Surface By Hay, Fiord, Steelcut, Steelcut Trio, Melange Nap, Divina, Divina Md, Divina Melange, Re-Wool, Canvas, Hallingdal, Lila, Raas and Vidar.‎

name: Manish Tables 67
about: With a bench on one side and chairs on the other, this Hopper Combo AA table suits everybody’s preferences.‎ Slip in from the sides on the attached bench, or grab a Captain’s Chair for a different seating spot.‎ This mono-material table offers more flexibility thanks to the open sides that welcome wheelchairs or child seats at any time.‎ Available in several colors, Hopper combo AA fits any setting.‎

name: Manish low Lounge chair 67
about:
Legs available in four different FSC-certified oak finishes
FSC-certified Thermo-treated Ash
Available in a wide variety of fabrics and leathers for indoor environments
Different upholsteries can have different appearances and some fabrics may wrinkle slightly around the curved seat
UV-protective and water resistant
Easy to clean


Soft, playful shapes characterise this family of upholstered pieces, the Hippo makes a stylish statement in any interior setting.‎ The Hippo series is influenced by the Hippopotamus mammal drawing upon its barrel-shaped torsos.‎ The characteristic wooden profile comes in four different FSC certified oak finishes; natural, light smoked, dark smoked and black and the seat and back come in variety of upholstery options.‎ 
Available in a wide variety of fabrics, leathers and COM/COL.‎
Different upholsteries can have different appearances and some fabrics may wrinkle slightly around the curved seat.‎
Seat made of Plywood and Cut Foam.‎ Backrest made of Massive Oak and Cut Foam.‎

name: Sameer Daybeds 76
about: Completing the Hippo series we are adding the Hippo Sofa, a sofa that can star as the centre piece of a room and add a stylish yet simple touch to any interior space.‎ Interesting from every angle the sofa shares the same characteristic leg profile of the Hippo Lounge fully upholstered with an oversized back providing great comfort.‎ The sofa is generously proportioned and can comfortably sit four persons.‎

name: Ayesha Daybeds 56
about:
Samet Low 81 is a seat element with triangle shaped back cushion upholstered in polyurethanefoam, removable cover.‎ Attention: With KINGSMAN and CORDUROY fabrics, the direction of the stripes runs perpendicular to the quilting.‎ With QUILT MALTA, QUILT VELOUR and 3D fabric, there is no quilting.‎ 3D fabric also provides only inner seam.‎

Samet Low is a modular sofa without rules, a multifunctional and configurable product that places the person as an active subject in the composition of their own space, encouraging them to experiment with new forms of use.‎ Cosy and hospitable seats are juxtaposed with each other in regular and soft geometries, a dynamic design to create multiple types of more or less informal seating.‎ Details, stitching and matelassé enrich a simple modularity that creates infinite compositions with a timeless aesthetic, from the most classic sofa to the most multifaceted, from the tidiest to the most disjointed.‎
